intro: Chondrachyrum, commonly known as the glassy spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems, which store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by colorful bracts. It is native to regions of southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
